channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous disintegrated road surface around drain on road outside No. 14, 20th February
item.description:
This large hole on the south and carriageway is worsening on a daily basis and presents a risk to road users. The hole is large and down towards the concrete surface below the tarmac. The manhole is approximately outside of number 14. The hole forces vulnerable road users into the centre of the carriageway and is a risk of serious injury or worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Four large potholes between White Oak Gardens and Annandale Road, 20th February
item.description:
On the Southbound carriageway there are four large potholes and several smaller ones. These are down to the concrete surface some 15 cm down and large enough to bring down a vulnerable road user on a bike. All are in the one metre to the kerb location that force cyclists into the centre of the carriageway. These are a risk to the safety of cyclists and unless addressed present a risk of serious injury or worse. Note! The earlier reporting of these potholes suggests they have been fixed - they have not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Willersley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazardous stones on footpath, 20th February
item.description:
Lots of stones on the footpath causing a hazard to public safety. Elderly and vulnerable people could slip and fall and cause hurt to themselves due to a large overspill of stones on the footpath in this area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lane, Eltham

item.title: Charlton rd / Blackheath overpass, 20th February
item.description:
Cycle path has a number of holes and the metal strip makes the corner very dangerous. Cars often cut through corner so avoiding the holes and metal makes this difficult to navigate.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Road, Charlton
